content.question:
Question 6 asks you to identify a pitch pattern that is played. You will have ten seconds to read the choices, and then you will hear the musical example played twice, with a brief pause between playings. Now listen to the music for Question 6 and identify the pitch pattern that is played.

Which of the following is played?

choices.label: Two-measure melody in treble clef. The time signature is four-four. The notes are quarter notes G4, F4, F5, E-flat 5 and half notes D-flat 5 and C5.
Two-measure melody in treble clef, time signature four-four. The notes are quarter notes G4, F4, F5, E-flat 5 and half notes D5 and C5.
Two-measure melody in treble clef, time signature four-four. The notes are quarter notes G4, F4, F5, E5 and half notes D-flat 5 and C5.
Two-measure melody in treble clef, time signature four-four. The notes are quarter notes G4, F4, F5, E5 and half notes D5 and C5.

content.answer: Two-measure melody in treble clef. The time signature is four-four. The notes are quarter notes G4, F4, F5, E-flat 5 and half notes D-flat 5 and C5.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
